intro: Hieracium alatum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium alatum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, making it a common weed in disturbed soils.
